name: Chih-Wen Hsueh
content: Chih-Wen Hsueh Homepage Á§´¼¤å, Chih-Wen (Steven) Hsueh Associate Professor Wireless Networking and Embedded Systems Laboratory ¡@ Graduate Institute of Networking and Multimedia Department of Computer Science and Information Engineering College of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science National Taiwan University Taipei 106, Republic of China (Taiwan) TEL: +886-2-33664888 ext.322 Skype: cwhsueh Line: cwhsuehline Email: Chih-Wen (Steven) Hsueh is an associate professor at the Graduate Institute of Networking and Multimedia and Department of Computer Science and Information Engineering at the National Taiwan University(NTUCSIE), R.O.C., since 2013, August, joined as an assistant professor in 2006 March. His research interests include real-time systems, embedded systems, and operating systems. He received his BS degree from NTUCSIE in 1989, June. After two years of military service, he worked for one year as a research assistant at the Institute of Information Science at the Academia Sinica, R.O.C. (ASIIS). He received his MS degree in Computer Science from the University of Southern California in 1994, June, and his Ph.D. in Information and Computer Science from the University of California at Irvine in 1997, December. Then, he worked for several startups in the Bay Area. He joined as an assistant professor at the Department of Computer Science and Information Engineering at the National Chung Cheng University, R.O.C., in 1999, August and an associate research engineer at ASIIS, in 2005, August.
